Description: About the job  Senior Full Stack Developer     Rate Guide: $900 ‚Äì $1,200 per day plus super @ 12%   Location: ACT, QLD, VIC, or NSW   Contract Duration: 6 months (to 30 June 2026) + 6-month extension option   Start Date: 4 December 2025   Hours: Up to 40 hours per week   Security Clearance: Must hold or be eligible to obtain Baseline   Working Arrangements: Hybrid ‚Äì flexible combination of office and remote work     Job Details  We are seeking a Senior Full Stack Developer to support a high-profile digital analytics platform within a federal environment. The successful candidate will join a small, technically strong development team within the Strategy function, working on the organisation‚Äôs flagship trade analytics platform ‚Äî a critical decision-support tool used across multiple business areas.  This role demands a developer capable of working across the full stack, from interactive front-end visualisations through to scalable APIs and data pipeline integration. You will contribute to expanding platform capabilities, improving performance, and strengthening integration between data, digital, and analytics systems.     Key Responsibilities  Develop responsive, interactive dashboards and data visualisations using modern JavaScript frameworks. Build component-based user interfaces with TypeScript and ensure cross-platform performance. Design and maintain scalable REST APIs using FastAPI and Python. Implement authentication and authorisation middleware integrating with Azure Entra ID. Support ETL workflows and optimise data queries within Azure Synapse Analytics. Integrate front-end systems with analytical data sources such as ClickHouse and Synapse. Implement real-time and batch data query systems with secure access patterns. Contribute to microservices design and deployment best practices. Participate in code reviews, documentation, and continuous improvement activities. Collaborate with stakeholders across Digital, Strategy, and Data teams.     Essential Criteria  Technical Expertise Strong experience with modern JavaScript frameworks (SvelteKit, React, or Vue.js). Proficiency in TypeScript and component-based architecture. Advanced experience with Python and API development (FastAPI preferred). Hands-on experience with ETL and data pipeline development (Azure Synapse Analytics desirable). Solid understanding of RESTful API design and microservices architecture. Familiarity with SvelteKit/FastAPI/ClickHouse stack highly desirable. Data and Analytics Experience Proven ability to build data-driven applications and analytics dashboards. Strong SQL knowledge and experience with analytical databases (ClickHouse, SQL Server, etc.). Understanding of data modelling, optimisation, and query performance tuning. Experience using D3.js, Apache ECharts, or similar data visualisation libraries. Cloud and DevOps Experience with Azure cloud environments and deployment patterns. Understanding of CI/CD pipelines and Infrastructure as Code principles. Experience with Docker and container orchestration tools. Government and Compliance Understanding of Australian Government data standards and compliance frameworks. Knowledge of privacy and data protection obligations under Australian law. Experience working within Australian Public Service environments preferred. Professional Skills Excellent analytical and problem-solving ability. Strong communication skills and clear technical documentation capability. Proven ability to work independently under guidance from senior advisors. Collaborative mindset and commitment to quality delivery.     Desirable Criteria  Prior experience working within Australian Government IT systems. Familiarity with trade, investment, education, or tourism data domains. Understanding of advanced analytics and machine learning concepts. Exposure to Agile methodologies and sprint-based delivery. Certifications in modern web development or cloud platforms (e.g. Azure Developer, AWS Developer).     Additional Requirements  Candidates must hold or be eligible to reinstate a Baseline security clearance prior to engagement.     Working Arrangements  Hybrid working conditions are available, with flexibility to work from Canberra, Brisbane, Melbourne, or Sydney offices. Onsite attendance may be required for key collaboration sessions.

About the job  Brief Description  Your new team  This role is a key Development role building out the best digital online experience for Auto and General‚Äôs customers. You will be building applications that allow customers to buy and manage their policies online, as well as contributing to the development of internal applications used by our staff to support business operations.  The role will work in one of several cross-functional agile teams, supported by a product owner and Scrum master. All software is delivered via agile teams and deployed via a modern DevOps/CI pipeline to AWS.  You will be involved in developing software that covers both our Front-End applications (web and mobile, including Flutter-based solutions) as well as supporting and building out our middleware and backend services deployed on AWS that are business critical.  This role will be working within a large team consisting of developers, testers, and agile practitioners in our Toowong location.  The role   Design and develop fit-for-purpose solutions to achieve sprint goals and deliver value to our business partners.  Leverage your experience to lead solution designs and development of our modern architecture.  Develop and maintain cross-platform mobile applications using Flutter, ensuring seamless integration with backend APIs and services.  Help build out our CI/CD pipeline and AWS deployment infrastructure.  Take ownership of the product, contributing improvement and innovation ideas.  Establish and own best practice testing across unit, integration, and end-to-end tests, including mobile testing practices.  Work collaboratively within a cross-functional Agile team, contributing to development, deployment, and support activities as required.  Perform other reasonable and relevant activities as requested from time to time to meet operational requirements.    Essential  What experience you‚Äôll bring   At least 3+ years of Software Development or relevant industry experience  Strong experience developing cross-platform mobile applications using Flutter and Dart, with an understanding of state management techniques  Excellent knowledge of modern front-end architecture  Deep knowledge of and adherence to software application security implications for web applications (e.g., OWASP)  Experience with technical documentation, including high-level and low-level designs, UML diagrams, user guides and system documentation  Experience using and configuring application and system monitoring tools  Experience with AWS Developer Tools and ecosystem, as well as Cloud deployment with Docker  Adherence to, and application of software application security standards  Ability to work in the Atlassian suite of products. JIRA, Confluence and Bitbucket    Advantageous   Familiarity with other modern web frameworks such as NgRx, React, or Vue  Understanding of security implications for web applications (OWASP)  Experience in or knowledge of GitLab DevOps Platform  Excellent knowledge of Angular 2+, JavaScript (ES 2015+) and Typescript  A background in financial services applications is an advantage    Toowong  Close to a variety of public transport and easy parking options, the Toowong office has excellent end of trip facilities (including secure bike storage and showers), outdoor spaces and plenty of modern collaborative areas to work and connect with colleagues.  Conveniently based at Toowong Village tower with views of the mountains and the Brisbane River, our location is only 4 km from the city and provides access to retail, restaurants and other amenities.  The benefits of working at A&G   Be rewarded - we recognise high performance and reward our people for their hard work through bonuses and other perks.  Work flexibility - with options to work from home two days per week.  Options for leave - life happens, so we‚Äôve got volunteer days, an additional paid ‚ÄòME‚Äô day, paid parental leave and the opportunity to purchase additional leave to cover all of the big stuff.  Grow with us - we‚Äôve got learning and professional development opportunities to suit everyone.  Give back - our A&G Difference program gives you the power to change our community for the better through volunteering, fundraising and donation opportunities for causes that you‚Äôre passionate about.  Take care of yourself - your wellbeing is important to us and our healthy mind and body hub, mental-health support and fitness discounts will help you be your best self.  Celebrate the wins - we love sharing our successes and celebrating together - join us and you‚Äôve got a ticket to our many on-site events throughout the year, family fun days and annual celebrations.  Save money - as well as discounts on insurance products, we‚Äôve teamed up with some incredible retailers, hospitality providers and others to bring you discounts on your purchases, no matter where you are in Australia.    About Us  Auto & General (A&G) is the fastest-growing major Motor and Home insurer in Australia, providing insurance products and solutions to safeguard a brighter future for our customers and community.  Our range of general insurance products including Car, Motorcycle, Home, Contents Pet and Travel products are delivered through our multi-award-winning brand Budget Direct and partnerships with leading brands - ING, Qantas, Virgin Money and Coles Insurance.  We‚Äôre excited about the future and we‚Äôre always on the lookout for talented, passionate individuals who can help us achieve our goal of being Australia‚Äôs best insurer! If this sounds like you, apply today.  Auto & General values individual differences and believes in fostering an inclusive culture that creates a great place to work for all.   A note from Auto & General to recruitment agencies: We politely ask that you avoid making any approaches or sending any unsolicited resumes to our Recruitment Team or Hiring Leaders across our business. Auto & General is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.   Internal Applicants: Please ensure your manager or team leader is aware of your application. If this sounds like your next challenge, click on the APPLY NOW button and submit your application.  We are accepting referrals for this position. If you know someone who has the right skills & experience, please encourage them to apply and advise our recruitment team

Job Title: Senior Software Engineer, Data Platform with verification
Description: About the job  Circle is a financial technology company at the epicenter of the emerging internet of money, where value can finally travel like other digital data ‚Äî globally, nearly instantly and less expensively than legacy settlement systems. This ground-breaking new internet layer opens up previously unimaginable possibilities for payments, commerce and markets that can help raise global economic prosperity and enhance inclusion. Our infrastructure ‚Äì including USDC, a blockchain-based dollar ‚Äì helps businesses, institutions and developers harness these breakthroughs and capitalize on this major turning point in the evolution of money and technology.  What You‚Äôll Be Part Of  Circle is committed to visibility and stability in everything we do. As we grow as an organization, we're expanding into some of the world's strongest jurisdictions. Speed and efficiency are motivators for our success and our employees live by our company values: High Integrity, Future Forward, Multistakeholder, Mindful, and Driven by Excellence. We have built a flexible and diverse work environment where new ideas are encouraged and everyone is a stakeholder.  What You‚Äôll Be Responsible For  As a member of the Data Platform Engineering team, you will own and evolve the core Data/ML platform ‚Äî including data ingestion and processing (with a focus on both traditional and blockchain data sources), ETL/ELT pipelines, data governance and security compliance, analytics and visualization tooling, data modeling, and warehousing. You will also design and build systems to monitor data pipelines and on-chain activity to ensure reliability, performance, and observability. This role requires close collaboration with Infrastructure, Data Science, and Engineering teams to align on diverse requirements and deliver scalable, high-impact solutions. You will also participate in maintaining existing infrastructure and join the on-call rotation to ensure the liveness and stability of services. These components power our Product, Engineering, Analytics, and Data Science functions by enabling experimentation, operational excellence, and actionable insights that drive business growth.  What You‚Äôll Work On   Design, build, and operate data platform services such as warehousing, orchestration, data catalogs, and ingestion frameworks. Develop and maintain scalable ingestion pipelines, including onchain/blockchain data ingestion, with robust handling of node APIs, rate limiting, and data consistency. Implement data alerting mechanisms to monitor critical events or anomalies in ingested data (e.g., specific on-chain transactions, contract changes, or volume spikes). Handle ingestion pipelines that operate across a broad range of scales, from small partner datasets to high-throughput blockchain transaction streams. Continuously improve platform operations through better monitoring, performance tuning, reliability enhancements, and resource optimization. Collaborate across Product, Engineering, Data Science, Security, and Compliance teams to establish data contracts, governance, and lifecycle management. Serve as a domain expert in data warehousing, data modeling, pipeline orchestration, and ensuring data quality at scale. Provide ML/AI platform capabilities for data scientists to run experiments, manage training data, and perform feature engineering. Build and maintain foundational services such as Data asset cataloging and lineage tracking Data versioning and quality metrics Auto-backfilling for incomplete data scenarios Fine-grained access control on datasets  What You‚Äôll Bring To Circle   4+ years of experience in software engineering, preferably focused on data systems. Familiarity with building or maintaining scalable data infrastructure for batch, micro-batch, or streaming pipelines. Exposure to business domains such as payments, banking, or blockchains is a plus. Understanding of data governance concepts like data lineage, quality, and access control. Interest in open-source data tools and technologies. Comfortable working through technical problems, even when requirements are not fully defined. Proactive, curious, and eager to learn and contribute in a fast-paced environment. Good communication skills and ability to collaborate with team members across functions and locations.   Nice To Have   Familiarity with blockchain data and a strong grasp of foundational cryptocurrency technologies and concepts.   Base Pay Range  $147,500 - $195,000  Circle is on a mission to create an inclusive financial future, with transparency at our core. We consider a wide variety of elements when crafting our compensation ranges and total compensation packages.  Starting pay is determined by various factors, including but not limited to: relevant experience, skill set, qualifications, and other business and organizational needs. Please note that compensation ranges may differ for candidates in other locations.  Base Pay Range: $147,500 - $195,000  We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at Circle. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Additionally, Circle participates in the E-Verify Program in certain locations, as required by law.  Should you require accommodations or assistance in our interview process because of a disability, please reach out to accommodations@circle.com for support. We respect your privacy and will connect with you separately from our interview process to accommodate your needs.

About the job  Key Responsibilities:  Directs, coaches, supports, supervises, and evaluates (with the Sous Chef) all direct reports. Must have excellent food knowledge and a full understanding of culinary terms. Must be able to read, understand, follow, and prepare company recipes by maintaining the quality and consistency in taste according to the instructions provided by the corporate office. Must be proficient in completing tasks, work efficiently and productively. Must be able to work in any section of a kitchen. Coordinate and supervise all team members assigned to their section, assign and delegate tasks accordingly. Undertake recipe reviews daily. Maintain recipe folders in immaculate condition. Responsible for follow-through on any request within the area of responsibility received from the direct supervisor or manager on duty; this may include show plates, food samples and random food tastings. Control production levels and recommend ideas for improvements and better cost controlling. Prepare daily electronic food requisitions needed for his section production and countercheck deliveries for its accuracy; Report any discrepancies to his immediate supervisor. Must be able to oversee any main section (Sauce, Entremetier, Fish, Roast, Outlet CDP, Tournant and Cold Kitchen) and its entire food production. Maintain and ensure that Public Health are followed according to company standards and expectation (referring to US, Anvisa, Shipsan, Canadian, Australian etc.) and always followed within their section. Ensures that the HACCP program is carried out correctly. Maintains their assigned area in preparation for announced or unannounced United States Public Health type inspection either done by the Food & Beverage Director or the actual inspectors. Reports for duty at assigned times, follows their supervisor‚Äôs instructions, and ensures that personal appearance, uniform, and personal hygiene are in accordance with the company‚Äôs rules and regulations.     Qualifications and Skills  A minimum of 8 years in an upscale hotel, resort, cruise ship or convention banqueting service and at least 2 years as Chef de Partie (shipboard experience preferred). A culinary school degree is required. Very strong management skills in a multicultural and dynamic environment. Very strong communication, problem solving, decision making, and interpersonal skills. Superior customer service, teambuilding, and conflict resolution skills. Knowledge of the principles and processes for providing personalized services including needs assessment techniques, quality service standards, alternative delivery systems, and guest satisfaction evaluation techniques. Strong planning, coaching, organizing, staffing, controlling, and evaluating skills. Intermediate computer software skills required. Possess a good understanding of basic accounting principles such as numbering flow, ‚ÄúDebits/Credits‚Äù, adjusting entries, and corrections. Ability to write reports and business correspondence and to establish a good rapport with the ship‚Äôs Senior Officers and the corporate office.

About the job  Our client, a prominent government agency, is seeking a Senior Full Stack Developer to join their Digital Products and Platforms Branch. This critical role involves working within a small development team under the Strategy Team to enhance 'Datathing,' a key trade analytics platform supporting trade and investment decisions across the agency.     Key responsibilities include:  Developing responsive, component-based frontend user interfaces using modern JavaScript frameworks such as SvelteKit, React, or Vue.js, leveraging TypeScript and data visualization libraries like Apache eCharts and D3.js. Implementing high-performance backend REST APIs utilizing FastAPI and Python, including authentication and authorization integrations with Azure Entra ID. Supporting and optimising data pipeline workflows and ETL processes on Azure Synapse Analytics, ensuring data accuracy and efficiency across frontend and backend systems. Integrating applications with data sources such as ClickHouse and Synapse, enabling real-time and batch data processing with secure authentication flows. Collaborating closely with Strategy, Trade, Go Global Toolkit, and Data teams to deliver features and extend platform integration capabilities. Participating in code reviews, documenting code, and sharing knowledge whilst contributing to continuous improvement of development practices within a hybrid working environment.     Candidate attributes:  Proven technical expertise in modern JavaScript frameworks, TypeScript, Python API development, and Azure cloud services. Strong experience with data-driven applications, analytics dashboards, SQL databases including ClickHouse or Microsoft SQL Server, and data visualization best practices. Experience with CI/CD pipelines, containerisation technologies, and microservices architecture. Understanding of Australian Government data standards, privacy laws, and compliance requirements. Excellent communication skills, strong analytical thinking, and ability to work both independently and collaboratively under senior guidance.     This is a 6-month contract opportunity (with a possible 6-month extension), offering a dynamic hybrid work model across various Australian locations including Canberra and Queensland.     Security clearance eligibility for Baseline level is required.     If you are an experienced Senior Full Stack Developer eager to contribute your skills to a vital government platform that supports national trade and investment strategies, we encourage you to explore this exciting role within our client‚Äôs team.     Balance Consulting Services is committed to equal opportunity employment. We celebrate diversity and encourage people from all sections of our community to apply for this role.

Job Title: Senior Software Engineer, Networking Platform with verification
Description: About the job  NVIDIA is looking for a highly motivated, creative, and passionate Software Engineer to design and develop a simulation software to integrate with many networking operating systems in the Networking Business Unit (NBU). This critical role entails tons of Python, Go and C development work in NVIDIAs switching software modules. You will be part of the team that develops the next generation simulation framework that spans across multiple Networking Operating Systems related to HPC, Ethernet AI, and more. We expect you to have strong programming skills, devops and Networking simulation experience, a good understanding of designing and building automation frameworks to integrate with simulation environments, especially related to Python and GoLang, C, experience with Networking Arch and Systems Software and Distributed systems, as well as excellent communication and planning skills.  Come Join a dynamic team driving the adoption and ongoing maintenance of simulation-based development and testing for Networking switches. You‚Äôll help build frameworks and libraries to promote simulation adoption, reduce hardware contention, and accelerate the identification and resolution of resource leaks and bugs. This role is pivotal in improving functional coverage and integrating simulation capabilities across multiple platforms and ASIC flavors.  What You'll Be Doing   Design, development and integration of Networking simulation framework for next-generation NVIDIA switch platforms Design and develop new simulation functionalities, while also maintaining and enhancing existing services Work collaboratively with team members, product managers, architects, QA, and other engineering teams to deliver high-quality solutions. Develop orchestration libraries using Nvidia Next Gen Simulation platform and automate bug reproduction. Innovate and rapidly develop proof-of-concept (POC) prototypes that can evolve into fully developed products or solutions. Engage closely with internal customers to understand their challenges, use cases, and deployment strategies, and devise innovative solutions. Orchestrate and build virtual environments with capabilities for custom module deployment for unit and integration test execution.   What We Need To See   BS or MS degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field (or equivalent experience). A minimum of 5+ years of software development experience with a strong emphasis on Networking, Linux, containers, and virtualization. Strong and validated experience in Python, GoLang and C programming. Strong technical abilities, problem-solving, design, coding, and debugging skills. Ability to quickly understand new requirements and technologies and swiftly prototype and implement solutions. Proficiency in programming and scripting for test automation and orchestration. Ability to integrate with external systems and tools for test management and Simulation (CI/CD, Build Acceptance Tests) Experience with test execution engines, topology management, and test status reporting. Ability to work cross-functionally and integrate simulation capabilities in networking modules Excellent communication skills.   Ways To Stand Out From The Crowd   Demonstrated expertise in building and maintaining large-scale simulation environments Experience with endurance and long-running test suites and proven ability to automate complex reproductions and manage multiple sims/vx architectures. Contributions to open-source frameworks and libraries that enhance simulation adoption and test coverage Innovative approaches to reducing hardware contention and accelerating bug resolution Python, GoLang and C programming skills   With competitive salaries and a generous benefits package, we are widely considered to be one of the technology world‚Äôs most desirable employers. We have some of the most forward-thinking and hardworking people in the world working for us and, due to unprecedented growth, our exclusive engineering teams are rapidly growing. If you're a creative and autonomous engineer with a real passion for technology, we want to hear from you. NVIDIA is widely considered to be one of the technology world‚Äôs most desirable employers. We have some of the most hard-working and talented people in the world working for us. If you're creative and passionate about developing cloud services we want to hear from you!  Your base salary will be determined based on your location, experience, and the pay of employees in similar positions. The base salary range is 148,000 USD - 235,750 USD.  You will also be eligible for equity and benefits .  Applications for this job will be accepted at least until October 30, 2025.NVIDIA is committed to fostering a diverse work environment and proud to be an equal opportunity employer. As we highly value diversity in our current and future employees, we do not discriminate (including in our hiring and promotion practices) on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status or any other characteristic protected by law.  JR2006612

Watsons serves over 6 billion shoppers annually through its O+O (Offline plus Online) platforms, offering an integrated tech-enabled retail experience. As a Front-end Engineer, you will help shape a customer-centric digital experience, building and maintaining web applications that simplify complex processes. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to design, develop, and optimize user interfaces while ensuring high quality and performance. This role involves prototyping solutions, collaborating in an agile environment, and rapidly iterating based on feedback. You will contribute to technical decisions, implement automated testing, and help maintain a robust, scalable front-end architecture. The position offers full remote flexibility, enabling you to work from anywhere in Latin America while having a direct impact on product development and user experience.  Accountabilities   Develop, design, debug, and enhance software components and tools in an agile environment Write automated unit and integration tests to support continuous integration pipelines Participate in code reviews to ensure code quality, flexibility, and maintainability Rapidly prototype minimum viable products and implement technical solutions with guidance from senior engineers Collaborate effectively with distributed cross-functional teams to resolve roadblocks and implement solutions Contribute to user story creation and continuously improve software development processes Maintain high standards of quality and performance across front-end codebases    Requirements   4+ years of professional front-end development experience Strong knowledge of HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and TypeScript Deep experience with front-end frameworks such as React, Angular, or Vue (React + Redux preferred) Skilled in testing frameworks like Jest and Cypress Familiarity with Software Development Lifecycle methodologies, particularly Scrum or Kanban Strong problem-solving and troubleshooting skills with attention to detail Ability to rapidly prototype and iterate in response to user feedback Experience with version control (Git) and CI/CD tools Excellent organizational skills, discipline, and collaborative mindset    Benefits   Fully remote work across Latin America üóì Flexible schedule and work-life balance üìà Opportunity to work on impactful products in a fast-paced startup environment üß© Collaborative and diverse team culture üõ† Access to modern front-end technologies and best practices üå± Continuous learning and growth opportunities within an agile environment   Jobgether is a Talent Matching Platform that partners with companies worldwide to efficiently connect top talent with the right opportunities through AI-driven job matching.  When you apply, your profile goes through our AI-powered screening process designed to identify top talent efficiently and fairly.  üîç Our AI evaluates your CV and LinkedIn profile thoroughly, analyzing your skills, experience, and achievements.  üìä It compares your profile to the job's core requirements and past success factors to determine your match score.  üéØ Based on this analysis, we automatically shortlist the three candidates who best match the role.  üß† When necessary, our human team may perform an additional manual review to ensure no strong profile is missed.  The process is transparent, skills-based, and free of bias ‚Äî focusing solely on your fit for the role. Once the shortlist is completed, we share it directly with the company that owns the job opening. The final decision and next steps (such as interviews or assessments) are managed by their internal hiring team.  Thank you for your interest!

Job Title: Engineering Manager - Onsite in SF with verification
Description: About the job  About Pump  Pump is an AI-driven cloud cost optimization platform that helps companies reduce cloud spend and maximize performance across AWS, GCP, and Azure. We‚Äôre backed by top-tier investors and rapidly scaling our team to meet growing customer demand.        About the Role  We're looking for a hands-on Engineering Manager to lead and grow our engineering team as we scale our AI-powered cloud optimization platform. You'll play a key leadership role in shaping technical strategy, building scalable systems, and mentoring top-tier engineering talent.     This is an onsite role where you‚Äôll stay actively involved in architecture and coding, while also managing people and processes. You‚Äôll work closely with the founding team and cross-functional partners to ensure our engineering organization is aligned with product and business goals.     Key Responsibilities  Lead and scale the engineering team from 5 to 10+ engineers, including hiring and team structuring Stay hands-on with architecture and development‚Äîthis is a technical leadership role Own the delivery of scalable, performant systems across AI, infrastructure, and cloud services Collaborate with product, design, and business teams to translate strategy into execution Mentor and develop engineers at all levels, fostering a high-performing, inclusive culture Help shape engineering culture, tooling, and practices as we grow     Minimum Qualifications  3‚Äì10 years of total engineering experience At least 2+ years in a managerial or technical leadership role Experience as a CTO, Eng Lead, or similar role at a company with $5M‚Äì$30M+ ARR Strong backend and infrastructure expertise, particularly with AWS, GCP, or Azure Solid understanding of AI/ML applications in cloud or infrastructure optimization Degree in Computer Science or a related technical field Availability to work onsite in San Francisco, Monday‚ÄìFriday     Ideal Candidate Profile  Previously managed or scaled engineering teams of 10‚Äì15+ people Built and scaled backend systems used by thousands of users Product-minded and data-driven with strong communication skills Comfortable navigating ambiguity and moving quickly in a startup environment Experience in a Series A or growth-stage startup a strong plus Previous founder or early employee experience is a bonus     Benefits (U.S. Full-Time Employees)  Comprehensive healthcare and dental coverage for you 401(k) plan Generous PTO: 13 accrued days, plus company shutdown December 24‚ÄîJanuary 1st Free lunch & dinner at the office Annual company-paid retreats Developmental bonuses: support for professional development opportunities tied to cloud and related fields     Compensation: $160,000 USD - $200,000 USD

About the job  Build Intelligent Systems from Model to UI ‚Äì and Everything in Between  At BJAK, we‚Äôre using AI to reinvent how financial services work across Southeast Asia, making them smarter, simpler, and more inclusive. As a Full Stack Engineer (AI) you‚Äôll bridge machine learning and software engineering to deliver real AI-powered features into users‚Äô hands.  This is a remote role based in Indonesia, working closely with our HQ in Malaysia and cross-functional regional teams. You‚Äôll operate across the stack, from backend logic and integration to frontend delivery, building intelligent systems that scale fast and matter deeply.  Why This Role Matters   You‚Äôll be the critical link between AI models and user-facing experiences Your work will shape how millions of people interact with innovative financial services You‚Äôll architect and deliver full-stack systems that combine backend, ML, and frontend layers You‚Äôll thrive in a lean, high-impact team where speed, ownership, and collaboration are everything   What You‚Äôll Do   Build and deploy full-stack applications that incorporate ML models Work with data scientists and ML engineers to integrate models into scalable backend systems Develop APIs, backend services, and real-time data pipelines for intelligent features Design clean, performant, and intuitive UIs that surface AI insights to users Own the full development lifecycle from architecture and testing to deployment and monitoring Collaborate with product, design, and engineering teams to ship polished, end-to-end solutions Continuously improve the performance, usability, and reliability of AI-integrated applications   You‚Äôll Thrive Here If You...   Own the outcome; you care about impact, not just lines of code Solve problems end-to-end, from data and systems to UI and user flow Build fast and iterate even quicker; V1 out now beats V3 someday Move forward even in chaos; ambiguity, shifting priorities, and lean resources excite you Think like a founder - you don‚Äôt wait to be told; you figure it out and ship Learn aggressively - new tools, frameworks, and failures that fuel your growth Have the humility to learn from others and the drive to help them grow Bring energy, clarity, and execution, and raise the bar for your team every day   Requirements   Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field 2‚Äì4 years of experience in full-stack development (frontend + backend) Strong programming skills in Python is a MUST and JavaScript (Node.js, React, or similar) Experience integrating ML models into production systems Familiarity with REST APIs, cloud deployment, and scalable architecture Comfortable working with SQL/NoSQL databases and distributed systems Strong grasp of software design patterns, testing, and debugging Must be based in Indonesia and open to remote collaboration with international teams   Nice to Have   Experience deploying ML models using tools like FastAPI, Flask, or TensorFlow Serving Familiarity with modern frontend stacks like Next.js, Vue, or TypeScript Exposure to ML tools like MLflow, Airflow, Docker, GCP, or AWS Background in high-growth startups or agile product teams Interest in explainable AI, visualizations, or surfacing complex ML outputs to end users   What You‚Äôll Get   Competitive salary and performance-based bonuses Remote-first setup with the flexibility to work from anywhere in Indonesia High-impact, high-ownership role in a product-led AI company Flat structure; your ideas are valued, and your code is seen Fast-track growth with real visibility across engineering, data, and product Regional exposure across Southeast Asia and the chance to shape products at scale   About BJAK  BJAK is Southeast Asia‚Äôs largest digital insurance platform. Headquartered in Malaysia and operating across Thailand, Taiwan, and Japan, we help millions of users access affordable financial protection through innovative, AI-driven systems. We simplify complex financial products through automation, recommendation engines, and intelligent APIs, making them more accessible, transparent, and fair.  If you're excited to bring AI to life through full-stack engineering - and thrive in a fast-moving, high-ownership environment, we‚Äôd love to hear from you.

Job Title: Software Development Engineer, Live Sports - Prime Video with verification
Description: About the job  Description  Interested in Machine Learning and AI? Our team's mission is to make machine learning easy, stronger, and universal in the world of Natural Language and Speech. We developed thriving ML services such as Comprehend, Kendra, Lex and Transcribe. We continuously work on adding new services to our portfolio, which address real world problems through research and innovation. We build state-of-the-art services using the latest deep learning techniques and highly scalable distributed systems engineering.  This role is in a new team that is building a new family of AI products. This team is considered strategic and has visibility with AWS leadership at the highest levels. The role offers a chance to build and launch new AI services from the ground up, learn the state of the art in machine learning (ML) technology, and work closely with an exceptional group of product, engineering, and science leaders. ML background is preferred but not required.  Job Code : 10013  Key job responsibilities  As a SDE, you will be responsible for designing, developing, testing, and deploying distributed machine learning systems and large-scale solutions for our world-wide customer base. In this, you will collaborate closely with a team of ML scientists to influence our overall strategy and define the team‚Äôs road map. You will also drive the system architecture, spearhead best practices that enable a quality product, and help coach and develop junior engineers. A successful candidate will have an established background in engineering large scale software systems, a strong technical ability, great communication skills, and a motivation to achieve results in a fast paced environment.  About The Team  *Utility Computing (UC)*  AWS Utility Computing (UC) provides product innovations ‚Äî from foundational services such as Amazon‚Äôs Simple Storage Service (S3) and Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (EC2), to consistently released new product innovations that continue to set AWS‚Äôs services and features apart in the industry. As a member of the UC organization, you‚Äôll support the development and management of Compute, Database, Storage, Internet of Things (Iot), Platform, and Productivity Apps services in AWS, including support for customers who require specialized security solutions for their cloud services.  **Diverse Experiences**  Amazon values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn‚Äôt followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don‚Äôt let it stop you from applying.   Why AWS Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world‚Äôs most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating ‚Äî that‚Äôs why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses. Diverse Experi   Basic Qualifications    5+ years of non-internship professional software development experience  5+ years of programming with at least one software programming language experience  5+ years of leading design or architecture (design patterns, reliability and scaling) of new and existing systems experience  Experience as a mentor, tech lead or leading an engineering team   Preferred Qualifications    3+ years of full software development life cycle, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations experience  Bachelor's degree in computer science or equivalent   Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of protected veteran status, disability, or other legally protected status.  Los Angeles County applicants: Job duties for this position include: work safely and cooperatively with other employees, supervisors, and staff; adhere to standards of excellence despite stressful conditions; communicate effectively and respectfully with employees, supervisors, and staff to ensure exceptional customer service; and follow all federal, state, and local laws and Company policies. Criminal history may have a direct, adverse, and negative relationship with some of the material job duties of this position. These include the duties and responsibilities listed above, as well as the abilities to adhere to company policies, exercise sound judgment, effectively manage stress and work safely and respectfully with others, exhibit trustworthiness and professionalism, and safeguard business operations and the Company‚Äôs reputation. Pursuant to the Los Angeles County Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.  Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you‚Äôre applying in isn‚Äôt listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.  Our compensation reflects the cost of labor across several US geographic markets. The base pay for this position ranges from $129,300/year in our lowest geographic market up to $223,600/year in our highest geographic market. Pay is based on a number of factors including market location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Amazon is a total compensation company. Dependent on the position offered, equity, sign-on payments, and other forms of compensation may be provided as part of a total compensation package, in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits. For more information, please visit https://www.aboutamazon.com/workplace/employee-benefits. This position will remain posted until filled. Applicants should apply via our internal or external career site.   Company - Amazon.com Services LLC  Job ID: A2938872

About the job  Closing Date  2025-11-14  Job Title: Software / Geospatial Developer  Location: Durrington or Falmer (hybrid with needs-based time in the office)  Contract Type: Permanent  Hours: 37 hours per week  Salary: circa ¬£70,000 depending on skills and experience  Storm overflows are not acceptable to us, our customers and stakeholders. We want to lead the charge in resolving the current situation. That‚Äôs where our Clean Rivers and Seas Task Force comes in, implementing pioneering and industry-leading solutions to reduce spills and reliance on overflows, whilst also enhancing the environment for our communities. While the team is delivering a ¬£1.5billion programme over the next 10 years, it is vital we keep our customers informed on progress and provide accurate and transparent data. We do this through our service called Rivers and Seas Watch.  Job Overview  As a Software / Geospatial Developer - you will be a key technical contributor to the development of Rivers and Seas Watch, a flagship digital product that transparently reports on storm overflows and water quality. You‚Äôll bring deep expertise across front-end and back-end technologies while also working extensively with low-code and no-code platforms such as ESRI ArcGIS Online and FME to deliver geospatial and data integration solutions.  ESRI and FME form a core part of our current technical stack, and proficiency or willingness to learn them is essential. to architect, build, and evolve customer-facing digital services that support our environmental mission.  You‚Äôll work within a multidisciplinary team of product owners, designers, researchers, and technical SMEs, driving forward the design and delivery of scalable, secure, and user-centric solutions. This role offers autonomy to influence over technical direction, with opportunities to shape best practices and mentor others.   Lead the design and implementation of robust software solutions for Rivers and Seas Watch, ensuring scalability, performance, and maintainability. Champion engineering excellence through coding standards, peer reviews, automated testing, and comprehensive documentation. Solve complex technical challenges with creativity and pragmatism, delivering high-impact solutions aligned with business and user needs. Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to translate strategic goals into technical deliverables. Stay ahead of emerging technologies and development trends, continuously enhancing your skillset and contributing to Southern Water‚Äôs innovation culture. Operate within Southern Water‚Äôs IT governance and regulatory frameworks, ensuring compliance and resilience.   About You   Proven experience in full-stack software development, with a strong portfolio of impactful projects. Advanced proficiency in modern front-end frameworks (e.g. React, Angular), with good knowledge of TypeScript.. Solid expertise in back-end development (e.g., Node.js, Python, .NET) and relational databases (e.g., SQL). Experience with cloud platforms (we use Azure) and modern DevOps practices. Experience with low-code/no-code geospatial tools such as FME and ESRI AGOL SDK is highly relevant, as these platforms are central to our current delivery approach. Comfortable working in Agile environments, with a strong understanding of iterative delivery and stakeholder engagement. Experience in regulated or large-scale enterprise environments is beneficial.   This is a unique opportunity to join a high performing and highly engaged team who are delivering a large innovative programme in partnership using sustainable and nature-based approaches to reduce the use of storm overflows and improve the environment. We know that over-use of storm overflows is a problem, so we are excited to invite you to be part of the solution!  Transparency Note  While this role includes traditional software development, a significant portion of the work involves configuring and integrating solutions using low-code/no-code platforms. We value developers who can combine coding expertise with adaptability to these tools. Full training on FME and ESRI will be provided if required.  Package  Benefits  This role will be full time Monday to Friday with a hybrid approach to working between our Falmer office and home. We are offering a salary of circa ¬£70,000 as well as other benefits including:   Generous pension up to 11% company contribution 25 days annual leave Life assurance equal to 4x salary Salary sacrifice electric car scheme (after 6 months service) Health Cash Plan Full funded eye tests Two paid volunteering days a year  Occupational health service Discounts with over 800 popular retailers Digital GP service Study support may be available for job-related qualifications  Competitive maternity leave and flexible return to work options Cycle to work scheme   Does this opportunity excite you but you‚Äôre not 100% sure if you meet all the requirements for the role? Or are you concerned that ‚Äònormal‚Äô office hours aren‚Äôt possible given your personal circumstances? Whilst we can‚Äôt accommodate every flexible working request, we‚Äôll try to find a practical solution. So why not engage with us and find out more about this role?  Our customers are at the heart of everything we do, because delivering water for life is our core purpose. To achieve this, we need 24/7 support in place to resolve incidents quickly and efficiently. All our employees understand the importance of out-of-hours incident support ‚Äì because when problems appear, fixing them is our top priority. That‚Äôs why our people join together and support when and however needed to make sure our customers get the service they deserve. Joining the Southern Water family means you‚Äôll become part of our incident support team. During your interview, your manager will speak to you about any incident support rotas that apply to your position.  Privacy Statement  Please note: If you are an existing Southern Water employee, you will need to confirm within your application that your Manager is aware of your application.  All applicants must be eligible to live and work in the UK. You will need to provide evidence of eligibility (e.g. a passport or long birth certificate and proof of NI) and current proof of address (dated within the last 3 months), will be required as part of the recruitment process. If you do not meet these criteria, your application will not be considered.

Job Title: CTO / IT Director - Relocation to Ghana
Description: About the job  A leading international company, pioneering in the ICT field in West Africa for 20 years, is looking for a talented and ambitious CEO to lead their winning team!        A role with real impact:  Managing a company that plans and executes a wide range of challenging and innovative national and private ICT projects that affect the lives of millions:  Conducting feasibility studies, planning, and overseeing large-scale projects. Developing advanced and integrated technological systems. Leading integration processes, outsourcing, and support. Providing comprehensive ICT solutions (Turnkey) to strategic clients.        Ideal candidate:  Academic degree from a leading institution: Bachelor‚Äôs degree in computer science, Computer/Information Systems Engineering, Electrical/Electronic Engineering, or exact sciences. Proven experience of 5-10 years in senior technological/program management roles in an international company. Technological expertise: Deep familiarity with integrated IT solutions, ERP, data centers, cloud computing, cybersecurity, and communication. Leadership and independent management ability: Overseeing the company from end to end, including project management, teams, budgets, and schedules. International experience: Experience working in various countries (experience in Africa, Asia, and South America is a plus). Adventurous spirit: Willingness to relocate fully with the family. Languages: High-level English.        Full relocation to an English-speaking country in West Africa.  Attractive financial conditions Comprehensive medical insurance

About the job  One of our Federal Government Clients is seeking to engage a Senior Full Stack Developer - EL1. This is a long-term contractual position.     Please check below all the job details:     Contract Duration: 12 Months (06 months initially + 06 months extension)  Work Location: Canberra / Brisbane / Sydney and Melbourne (03 Days office/02 Days home per week)  Eligibility: You must need to have Baseline Security Clearance or above.  Tentative Start Date: 04th Dec 2025     Position Description:     Department is seeking an experienced Full Stack Developer to join their Digital Products and Platforms Branch. This position will be seconded to work with a small development team under the Strategy Team. The role requires a skilled professional who can work across the full technology stack, with expertise in modern frontend frameworks, data pipeline architecture, and API development.     The Full Stack Developer responsibilities include:     Frontend Development and Data Visualisation:      Develop interactive dashboards and analytics interfaces using modern JavaScript frameworks. Build responsive, component-based UI features with TypeScript. Create compelling data visualisations using Apache eCharts, D3.js, or similar libraries. Implement server-side rendering for optimal performance.     Backend API Development:      Implement scalable REST APIs using FastAPI and Python. Develop authentication and authorisation middleware integrating with Azure Entra ID. Build efficient caching strategies and error handling patterns. Contribute to API documentation and versioning practices.     Data Pipeline and ETL Support:      Support ETL processes using Azure Synapse Analytics. Assist in optimising data query performance between frontend applications and backend data sources. Implement data transformation workflows for analytical requirements. Help ensure data quality and integrity throughout the pipeline.     Integration and Development:     Connect frontend applications with backend data sources, including ClickHouse and Synapse. Implement query systems for real-time and batch data processing. Develop secure authentication flows and data access patterns. Contribute to the team‚Äôs microservices architecture.     Team Collaboration:      Work closely with the Senior Advisor and Strategy Team members. Collaborate with stakeholders across Digital, Strategy, and Data teams. Document code and technical implementations. Participate in code reviews and team knowledge sharing. Support the continuous improvement of development practices.     Essential Criteria:     Technical Expertise:      Strong experience with modern JavaScript frameworks (SvelteKit, React, or Vue.js). Proficiency in TypeScript and component-based architecture. Extensive experience with Python and API development (FastAPI preferred). Hands-on experience with ETL processes and data pipeline development, preferably Azure Synapse Analytics. Solid understanding of RESTful API design principles and microservices architecture. Experience with SvelteKit/FastAPI/ClickHouse stack highly desirable.     Data and Analytics Experience:     Experience building data-driven applications and analytics dashboards. Strong knowledge of SQL and experience with analytical databases (ClickHouse, Microsoft SQL Server, or similar). Understanding of data modelling, optimisation, and query performance tuning. Experience with data visualisation libraries and best practices.     Cloud and DevOps:     Experience with Azure cloud services and deployment patterns. Understanding of CI/CD pipelines and infrastructure as code. Knowledge of containerisation (Docker) and orchestration tools.     Government and Compliance:      Understanding of Australian Government data standards and compliance requirements. Knowledge of Australian privacy laws and data protection regulations. Experience working within Australian Public Service environments preferred.     Professional Skills:      Strong analytical and problem-solving capabilities. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Ability to work effectively within a team under senior guidance. Self-motivated with ability to manage assigned tasks independently.     Desirable Criteria:     Experience with government IT systems and processes. Familiarity with trade, investment, international education, and/or tourism data domains. Knowledge of advanced data analytics and machine learning concepts. Experience with Agile development methodologies. Relevant certifications in cloud platforms or modern web development.     The Next step is easy: If you are interested, you may send an email to Krishna.R@italliance.com.au     Referral incentive program: As always, we have the candidate referral incentive program through which you will get $1000 for each successful referral after the successful selection and joining of the referred candidates.

About the job  üöÄ [Remote] Software Architect Trainee Programme     üí° What You‚Äôll Learn & Experience  Backend Development using C# and Python Frontend Engineering with Angular, ReactJS, and ElectronJS DevOps & IT Security ‚Äì virtualization, authentication frameworks, deployment pipelines, and secure software delivery Linux Shell Scripting for automation and system control High-Performance Systems ‚Äì parallel processing and low-latency technologies for live data platforms Machine Learning & MLOps ‚Äì from research to deployment and monitoring Hybrid Infrastructure Management ‚Äì orchestrating systems across on-premise servers and cloud environments Enterprise Code Management ‚Äì designing test-driven, decoupled, API-based systems at scale Project & People Management ‚Äì writing technical requirements, documenting systems, and delegating effectively     You‚Äôll be challenged to think like an architect, move like a founder, and execute like an elite engineer.     This is a high-intensity programme built for future technology leaders.     üß≠ Job Title  Software Architect Trainee  üîß Job Scope  IT Operations & System Support Technical Documentation Project Management Coding & Product Testing System Design Exposure to Financial Markets & Products  ‚ö†Ô∏è Important Note  This programme focuses on developing pragmatic problem solvers ‚Äî professionals who understand technology deeply and can build real, end-to-end solutions for real users.  If your main interest lies only in coding without exposure to testing, documentation, or system-level design, this may not be the right fit.  üéì Requirements  Final-year student or recent graduate (max. 2 years experience) Background in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Mathematics, or related STEM fields Able to commit full-time for 6 months Fluent in English (written and spoken) Hands-on experience in web development Proficient in at least one backend and one frontend stack Strong problem-solving and analytical mindset Driven, self-motivated, and eager to learn in a fast-paced environment Excellent communication and collaboration skills Interest in the financial markets is a plus Aspiration to grow into a future technology leader

About the job  Job Details  Description  Department: Baseball Operations, Research & Development  Reports to: Assistant Director of Development, Research & Development  Classification: Full-Time/Exempt  Location: Houston, TX  Summary/Objective:   The Houston Astros are seeking a Staff Software Engineer to join our Software Development team within the Research and Development department. This role is ideal for a seasoned developer who thrives in a collaborative, fast-paced environment and is passionate about building scalable, maintainable systems that directly impact baseball decision-making.  You‚Äôll work across the full stack‚Äîfrom ingesting and transforming data to building intuitive front-end applications. You‚Äôll help shape architectural decisions, modernize legacy systems, and champion engineering excellence across the department.  Essential Functions & Responsibilities:  Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.   Design, build, and maintain full-stack applications that support Baseball Operations Build scalable, automated systems with longevity and maintainability in mind Modernize legacy codebases while ensuring continuity of critical systems Ensure adherence to best practices in software development, including code reviews, testing, continuous integration, and documentation Serve as a technical leader and mentor, while remaining hands-on as an individual contributor Participate in a rotating on-call schedule to address any urgent issues with our software systems Perform other duties as assigned   Experience & Skills:   5+ years of professional software development experience Proven experience working across the stack: DevOps tooling, backend (C#, Python), frontend (Javascript/Typescript, React.js), and data pipelines (SQL Server, Databricks) Strong understanding of system architecture and design patterns Experience maintaining and refactoring legacy codebases Proficiency in modern development practices: testing, CI/CD, infrastructure as code, etc. Self-starter with excellent communication and collaboration skills Experience influencing others and advocating for technical excellence while being open to change when needed Experience working with sports data is a plus   Work Environment  This job operates in an office setting. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers, phones and photocopiers. The noise level is usually moderate but can be loud within the stadium environment.  Physical Demands  While performing the duties of this job, the employee is occasionally required to stand; walk; sit (for long periods of time); use hands to handle or feel objects, tools or controls; reach with hands and arms; climb stairs; talk or hear. The employee may occasionally lift or move equipment, up to 20 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close and focused vision.  Position Type and Expected Hours of Work  Ability to work a flexible schedule, including; extended hours, evenings, weekends, and holidays.  Travel  Some travel may be expected in this role.  Other Duties  Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice.  We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.   EOE/M/F/Vet/Disability
